channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Pentagon puts Scouts 'on notice' over DEI and girl-centered policies
item.description: After threatening to sever ties with the organization formerly known as the Boy Scouts, Defense Secretary Hegseth announced a 6-month reprieve
item.content:encoded:
After threatening to sever ties with the organization formerly known as the Boy Scouts, Defense Secretary Hegseth announced a 6-month reprieve

(Image credit: X video by @SecWar / screengrab by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Graham Smith

item.title: NASA redirects Artemis moon mission program, postponing a planned astronaut landing
item.description: In shaking up its Artemis lunar program, NASA's new moon plan looks more like the Apollo missions of the 1960s. Instead of landing on the surface on Artemis III, NASA hopes to do so on Artemis IV.
item.content:encoded:
In shaking up its Artemis lunar program, NASA's new moon plan looks more like the Apollo missions of the 1960s. Instead of landing on the surface on Artemis III, NASA hopes to do so on Artemis IV.

(Image credit: Gregg Newton)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: OpenAI announces Pentagon deal after Trump bans Anthropic
item.description: Shortly after the president's ban of artificial intelligence company Anthropic, rival OpenAI announced it had done a deal with the Defense Department to provide its technology for classified networks.
item.content:encoded:
Shortly after the president's ban of artificial intelligence company Anthropic, rival OpenAI announced it had done a deal with the Defense Department to provide its technology for classified networks.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: HUD proposes time limits and work requirements for rental aid
item.description: The rule would allow housing agencies and landlords to impose such requirements "to encourage self-sufficiency." Critics say most who can work already do, but their wages are low.
item.content:encoded:
The rule would allow housing agencies and landlords to impose such requirements "to encourage self-sufficiency." Critics say most who can work already do, but their wages are low.

(Image credit: Jon Cherry)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Paramount and Warner Bros' deal is about merging studios, and a whole lot more
item.description: The nearly $111 billion marriage would unite Paramount and Warner film studios, streamers and television properties — including CNN — under the control of the wealthy Ellison family.
item.content:encoded:
The nearly $111 billion marriage would unite Paramount and Warner film studios, streamers and television properties — including CNN — under the control of the wealthy Ellison family.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein/AP)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: A new film follows Paul McCartney's 2nd act after The Beatles' breakup
item.description: While previous documentaries captured the frenzy of Beatlemania, Man on the Run focuses on McCartney in the years between the band's breakup and John Lennon's death.
item.content:encoded:
While previous documentaries captured the frenzy of Beatlemania, Man on the Run focuses on McCartney in the years between the band's breakup and John Lennon's death.

(Image credit: Linda McCartney)
item.dc:creator: David Bianculli

item.title: An aspiring dancer. A wealthy benefactor. And 'Dreams' turned to nightmare
item.description: A new psychological drama from Mexican filmmaker Michel Franco centers on the torrid affair between a wealthy San Francisco philanthropist and an undocumented immigrant who aspires to be a dancer.
item.content:encoded: A new psychological drama from Mexican filmmaker Michel Franco centers on the torrid affair between a wealthy San Francisco philanthropist and an undocumented immigrant who aspires to be a dancer.
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang

item.title: My doctor keeps focusing on my weight. What other health metrics matter more?
item.description: Our Real Talk with a Doc columnist explains how to push back if your doctor's obsessed with weight loss. And what other health metrics matter more instead.
item.content:encoded: Our Real Talk with a Doc columnist explains how to push back if your doctor's obsessed with weight loss. And what other health metrics matter more instead.
item.dc:creator: Mara Gordon

item.title: Baz Luhrmann will make you fall in love with Elvis Presley
item.description: The new movie is made up of footage originally shot in the early 1970s, which Luhrmann found in storage in a Kansas salt mine.
item.content:encoded:
The new movie is made up of footage originally shot in the early 1970s, which Luhrmann found in storage in a Kansas salt mine.

(Image credit: NEON)
item.dc:creator: Tim Greiving

item.title: Forget the State of the Union. What's the state of your quiz score?
item.description: What's the state of your union, quiz-wise? Find out!
item.content:encoded: What's the state of your union, quiz-wise? Find out!
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris
